bug.author: lorelupo
bug.summary: fairseq-score --sacrebleu returns object instead of score
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
fairseq-score returns a python object instead of a score when setting the flag --sacrebleu. To fix this, please modify
fairseq/fairseq_cli/score.py
Line 61 in f57b148
print(sacrebleu.corpus_bleu(fdsys, [fdref]))
to print(sacrebleu.corpus_bleu(fdsys, [fdref]).format()) <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran):
Run cmd 'fairseq-score --sys gen.sys --ref gen.out --sacrebleuwith whatevergen.sysandgen.out` files.
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
fairseq-score --sys $sdir/logs/test.detok.sys --ref $sdir/logs/test.detok.ref --sacrebleu returns <denchmark-code>Namespace(ignore_case=False, order=4, ref='checkpoints/wmt14/transfo_base/logs/test.detok.ref', sacrebleu=True, sentence_bleu=False, sys='checkpoints/wmt14/transfo_base/logs/test.detok.sys') <sacrebleu.metrics.bleu.BLEUScore object at 0x7f0b57584af0> </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
BLEU score printed.
